channel.title: Super Admin Documentation
channel.description: Recent content on Super Admin Documentation

item.title: Browser Support
item.description: Browser Support Understand which browsers are compatible with Super Admin and how to manage vendor prefixes. Supported browsers All major browsers and platforms are supported by Super Admin, including the most recent stable releases. You can find our supported range of browsers and their versions in the browserslist entry in package.json "browserslist": [ "last 2 versions", "not dead", "not ie > 0" ], We use Autoprefixer to handle intended browser support via CSS prefixes, which uses Browserslist to manage these browser versions.

item.title: Charts
item.description: Charts Linar Admin uses Chart.js for all of it’s charting content. Chart.js is a free and open source HTML5 based JavaScript charting library. It is easy to use, responsive, flexible and feature rich. It supports different chart types like line, bar, pie, radar, polar area, bubble and scatter charts. Official documentation: https://www.chartjs.org/ Bar Chart A bar chart provides a way of showing data values represented as vertical bars. It is sometimes used to show trend data, and the comparison of multiple data sets side by side.

item.title: Customization
item.description: CSS Variables Similar to the core Bootstrap framework, Super Admin employs CSS custom properties (variables) for managing its theme-specific attributes. To simplify this process, Super Admin uses an SCSS map (_theme.scss) to store all the values associated with each theme. $themes: ( 1: (#772036 #ffffff #ffe4e6 #ffc8cc rgba(#1A0A00, 0.4)), 2: (#273c5b #ffffff #e0eaff #a6bccf rgba(#364d75, 0.75)), 3: (#0d2b2d #cbf3f3 #92bbbb #638d8d rgba(#1A0A00, 0.4)), 4: (#632144 #ffe4e5 #f8d9da #e7b7b8 rgba(#1A0A00, 0.4)), 5: (#2d271d #fffbf6 #f7ecdf #f0dec8 rgba(#1A0A00, 0.

item.title: Development Dependencies
item.description: Development Dependencies Super Admin relies on several open-source projects to function correctly. The following catalog outlines the primary dependencies and their roles within the project. Parcel Super Admin uses Parcel as its bundler. Parcel is responsible for bundling all the required files and dependencies of the project into a single, optimized file that can be served to the browser. ParcelJS is different from other bundlers like webpack because it does not require any configuration or setup to get started.

item.title: Form Components
item.description: Datepicker A lightweight vanilla javascript library that replaces native select elements with customizable dropdowns. The datepicker allows users to enter a date either through text input, or by choosing a date from the calendar. Date pickers can be embedded into dialogs on mobile and text field dropdowns on desktop. <!-- Basic --> <input type="text" class="form-control date-picker" /> <!-- Range --> <div class="date-range-picker gap-2"> <input type="text" name="start" value="07/10/2023" class="form-control" required readonly /> <input type="text" name="end" value="07/13/2023" class="form-control" required readonly /> </div> <!

item.title: Form Components
item.description: Simplebar SimpleBar replaces the browser’s default scrollbar with a custom CSS-styled one without losing performances. Unlike some popular plugins, SimpleBar doesn’t mimic scroll with Javascript, causing janks and strange scrolling behaviours. <div data-simplebar> <!-- Scrollable content goes here... --> </div> JS file: /src/js/vendors.js Official documentation: https://github.com/Grsmto/simplebar

item.title: Form Templates
item.description: Login form Sample login form with basic input fields. <form class="col-md-6"> <div class="mb-3"> <input type="text" class="form-control" id="login-username" placeholder="Username" /> </div> <div class="mb-3"> <input type="password" class="form-control" id="login-password" placeholder="Password" /> </div> <div class="form-check mb-5"> <input class="form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="" id="login-cb" /> <label class="form-check-label" for="login-cb">Stay logged in</label> </div> <button type="submit" class="btn btn-theme">Login</button> </form> Registration form Sample sign up form basic with names, email and password fields. <form class="row g-4 col-md-7"> <div class="col-md-6"> <input type="text" class="form-control" id="reg-firstname" placeholder="First Name" /> </div> <div class="col-md-6"> <input type="text" class="form-control" id="reg-lastname" placeholder="Last Name" /> </div> <div class="col-md-12"> <input type="email" class="form-control" id="reg-email" placeholder="Email Address" /> </div> <div class="col-md-6"> <input type="password" class="form-control" id="reg-password" placeholder="Password" /> </div> <div class="col-md-6"> <input type="password" class="form-control" id="reg-cpassword" placeholder="Confirm Password" /> </div> <div class="col-md-12"> <div class="form-check mb-8"> <input class="form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="" id="reg-cb" /> <label class="form-check-label" for="red-cb">I have read and accept the agreement</label> </div> <button type="submit" class="btn btn-theme">Create Account</button> </div> </form> Contact form Sample contact form name, email and message fields.

item.title: Icons
item.description: Overview Super Admin uses Phosphor Icons as the default icons library for all of it’s font-icon requirements. Phosphor icons consolidating over 7000 glyphs with a wide range of design variants. Icons are available in six variants (Thin, Light, Regular, Bold, Fill and Duotone). Basic usage Use a consistent <i> tag to reference the icons in your code. Start browsing the icons page to find and copy the classname of icons.

item.title: Maps
item.description: Maps Linear Admin uses JSvectormap to meet all of its mapping requirements. Jsvectormap is a lightweight JavaScript library for creating interactive maps and pretty data visualization, supports all modern brownsers including IE9+. Plugin documentation: https://github.com/themustafaomar/jsvectormap Basic usage Simply include the following HTML and JS code along with the map file to render the map in you web page. HTML <div id="map-world"></div> Javascript import jsVectorMap from "jsvectormap"; import "jsvectormap/dist/maps/world.js"; new jsVectorMap({ selector: "#map-world", map: "world", draggable: false, zoomButtons: false, zoomOnScroll: false, regionStyle: { initial: { fill: "#cccccc", "fill-opacity": 1, stroke: "none", }, } }); Available maps Path for statically loadable maps is: /src/js/vendors/jsvectormap/maps

item.title: Page Templates
item.description: Page Templates Super Admin uses 4 different page templates to help you get started with your project. Each template has a different layout and is designed to be used in different scenarios based on the content of the page. Two Column - Sidebar and Body The two column template is the most common layout used in Super Admin. It has a sidebar on the left and a body on the right.

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Quick Start Below is a brief guide to help you quickly get started and start using Super Admin. What’s included The Super Admin source code includes HTML, javascript, font assets, images and SVG files along with source SCSS and documentation. More specifically, it includes the following and more: documentation/ app/ ├── production/ └── development/ ├── src/ │ ├── scss/ │ ├── img/ │ ├── js/ │ ├── fonts/ │ └── html/ │ ├── pages/ │ │ ├── index.

item.title: Themes
item.description: Themes Super Admin offers 8 distinct and uniquely crafted themes, unlike anything you’ve seen before. The entire user interface of the template is designed to seamlessly integrate with each theme, providing a truly unique experience. Available Themes Currently the Super Admin 3.0 comes with the following 8 themes. More themes will be followed with future updates. Solaris Galaxy Forest Red Velvet Desert Northern Light Northern Light Kinetic Activating a theme You can activate these themes by clicking on the theme toggle button (with a color palette icon) located in the right side of the page.
